description: From Latin dictum (“proverb, maxim”), from dictus (“having been said”), perfect passive participle of dico (“I say”). Compare Spanish dicho (“saying”).

entries.meaning: An authoritative statement; a dogmatic saying; a maxim, an apothegm.
examples: […] a dictum which he had heard an economics professor once propound […]

entries.meaning: A judicial opinion expressed by judges on points that do not necessarily arise in the case, and are not involved in it.
The report of a judgment made by one of the judges who has given it.
